content.protection: A standard rack will cover the available placements. Plenty of locations to place gear, but the friable nature of the rock means that most placements should be treated with suspicion.

content.description:
â€œTwo vast and trunkless legs of stone stand in the desert." Percy Shelley.

The Main Wall has a groove running half way up its middle section, this climb starts left of the groove and diagonals right to the bottom of the groove but traverses boldly (for a TR) right on a foot ledge onto the black plated wall, up this at 5.10ish to a horizontal break. Then tackle the headwall past two pockets (crux) and so to the top.
content.location: Starts in the groove in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Up easily to the first overhang (hex or friend), strenuously through this to easier ground which leads to the second roof, which is bypassed to the right - wires and maybe even an old bolt(?) protect the slabby 5.6 moves to gain a chimney to the top.
content.protection: Trad rack - big pieces and some larger wires.
content.location: The obvious crack/fault up the middle of the West Wall.
